---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(ggiraphExtra)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
 mydata <- iris
```

## Model 1

- Uses petal length as predictor

```{r, echo=TRUE}
    model1 <- lm(Sepal.Length ~ Petal.Length, mydata)
```

## Model 1 plot

```{r}
     ggPredict(model1)
```

## Model 2

- Uses petal length and width as predictor

```{r, echo=TRUE}
    model2 <- lm(Sepal.Length ~ Petal.Length + Petal.Width, mydata)
```

## Model 2 plot

```{r}
     ggPredict(model2)
```

## Comparison of the two models

```{r}
anova(model1, model2)
```

Adding petal length improves the accuracy of the model.

- Lower RSS
- p-value < 0.05
